meanings.definition: The act of accusing or charging with a crime or wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The inculpation of the suspect led to their arrest.
meanings.sent2: Her inculpation of the thief helped solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The inculpation of the cat for stealing the cookies was a funny misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: The inculpation of the storm for the power outage was a clever way to describe the situation.
meanings.sent5: The inculpation of the student for cheating was clear and undeniable.

meanings.definition: The state of being blamed or held responsible for something.
meanings.sent1: His inculpation in the accident left him feeling guilty.
meanings.sent2: The inculpation of the company for the environmental damage was severe.
meanings.sent3: The inculpation of the dog for eating the homework was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The inculpation of the wind for the fallen tree was poetic.
meanings.sent5: Her inculpation in the mistake was evident to everyone.
